FuncDef: This command specifies the address range to be used as the local VXLAN VTEP on the ISA for service chaining. The system allocates one address for each ISA in the NAT group out of the specified range. The allocated address appears as /32 or /128 routes in the global routing table with the route typenat.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the start address of the VXLAN VTEP range.
Specifies the end address of the VXLAN VTEP range.
Specifies an IPv4 address start and end range. Values-ipv4-address - a.b.c.d.
Specifies an IPv6 address start and end range.
